criteriaResults.criterion: Each task has specific, testable acceptance criteria
criteriaResults.reasoning: Each task file contains specific, testable acceptance criteria. criteriaResults.criterion: Task dependencies are correctly defined
criteriaResults.reasoning: Task dependencies are correctly defined using dependsOn arrays in frontmatter. core.asset-entity depends on core.database-schema; core.status-service depends on both core.asset-entity and core.status-enum; core.base-service depends on core.asset-entity, core.code-generator, and core.status-service; core.location-controller depends on core.location-service; core.attachment-controller depends on core.attachment-service.

criteriaResults.criterion: Base entity and database schema tasks are prioritized
criteriaResults.reasoning: Base entity and database schema tasks are correctly prioritized. Within task files, database-schema has priority 1 and asset-entity has priority 2. Database schema has no dependencies (dependsOn: []) ensuring it runs first.

criteriaResults.criterion: Code generator and status machine tasks are included
criteriaResults.reasoning: Code generator task (core.code-generator, priority 104/4) includes detailed requirements: format rules (HA-000001), optimistic locking implementation, retry logic, and unique constraint handling. Status machine task (core.status-enum, priority 103/3) defines all 9 states, transition validation methods (canTransitionTo, getValidTransitions), and terminal state handling. Status service task (core.status-service, priority 105/5) implements status change logic.

criteriaResults.criterion: Attachment and location hierarchy tasks are included
criteriaResults.reasoning: Attachment tasks include: core.attachment-service (priority 107/7) with upload limits (10 files, 5MB), file type validation, storage path generation; core.attachment-controller (priority 110/10) with REST API endpoints. Location hierarchy tasks include: core.location-service (priority 106/6) with 3-level hierarchy, tree structure, validation; core.location-controller (priority 109/9) with tree API endpoint.

criteriaResults.reasoning: Test requirements from QA-STRATEGY.md are addressed. The tasks comprehensively cover Excel parsing, validation services, template generation for all 5 asset types, error reporting via ImportResult/ValidationResult/RowError classes, and the 3-step wizard frontend modal.

Consider adding explicit async/progress tracking for large file imports (the criteria mention <30s for 1000 rows but no progress reporting mechanism is specified beyond the basic progress bar in Step 2)
codeQualityNotes: Good separation of concerns: parsing, validation, import, and template generation are separate tasks
Well-defined data structures: ImportResult, ValidationResult, and RowError provide clear contracts
Appropriate dependency chain ensuring proper build order
Good coverage of error scenarios including file validation, row validation, and transaction rollback modes

criteriaResults.criterion: All fine-grained implementation tasks are created in ai/tasks/dashboard/
criteriaResults.reasoning: 6 fine-grained implementation tasks are created in ai/tasks/dashboard/: 01-statistics-service.md, 02-controller.md, 03-frontend-layout.md, 04-kpi-cards.md, 05-charts.md, and 06-refresh-button.md. All tasks are properly registered in ai/tasks/index.json with unique IDs (dashboard.statistics-service, dashboard.controller, dashboard.frontend-layout, dashboard.kpi-cards, dashboard.charts, dashboard.refresh-button).

criteriaResults.criterion: Each task has specific, testable acceptance criteria
criteriaResults.reasoning: Each task has detailed, specific, and testable acceptance criteria. For example: dashboard.statistics-service has 5 numbered criteria with specific interface methods, VO fields, and performance requirements (<2s). dashboard.controller has 5 criteria with specific endpoints, paths, and permission annotations. dashboard.kpi-cards has 4 criteria with specific card implementations, props, and styling requirements. All criteria are measurable and verifiable.

criteriaResults.criterion: Task dependencies on core, asset, and maintenance modules are defined
criteriaResults.reasoning: Task dependencies are properly defined in YAML frontmatter. dashboard.statistics-service depends on core.base-service, asset-house.service, asset-parking.service, maintenance.order-service. dashboard.controller depends on dashboard.statistics-service. Frontend tasks (layout, kpi-cards, charts, refresh-button) depend on dashboard.controller or dashboard.frontend-layout. The BREAKDOWN.md itself depends on core.BREAKDOWN, asset-house.BREAKDOWN, asset-parking.BREAKDOWN, maintenance.BREAKDOWN.

criteriaResults.criterion: Statistics service with aggregation queries is included
criteriaResults.reasoning: dashboard.statistics-service (01-statistics-service.md) includes comprehensive aggregation query requirements: IDashboardService interface with getStats, getRecentOrders, getAssetDistribution, getStatusDistribution methods. Specifies aggregation queries using SQL COUNT/SUM, mapper methods for countByStatus, countByType, sumAssets, and performance requirement of <2s.

criteriaResults.criterion: Role-based dashboard layout tasks are included
criteriaResults.reasoning: dashboard.frontend-layout (03-frontend-layout.md) includes 3 role-based layout variants: Management/Operations Layout (KPI cards, charts, recent activity), Maintenance Staff Layout (simplified view, work order queue, no charts), and Asset Manager Layout (asset counts, distribution charts, recent additions). Role detection from Vuex store is specified.

criteriaResults.criterion: KPI cards and charts tasks are included
criteriaResults.reasoning: KPI cards task (04-kpi-cards.md) specifies reusable KpiCard.vue component with props (title, value, suffix, icon, trend, color) and 4 specific cards (Total Assets, Vacancy Rate, Pending Work Orders, Completed This Month). Charts task (05-charts.md) specifies ECharts integration with StatusPieChart.vue, AssetTypePieChart.vue, TrendLineChart.vue, and ChartWrapper.vue components.

criteriaResults.criterion: Manual refresh functionality is included
criteriaResults.reasoning: dashboard.refresh-button (06-refresh-button.md) includes comprehensive manual refresh functionality: refresh button in header, loading state during fetch, button disable during loading, 'Last updated: HH:mm' timestamp, refresh logic calling all dashboard APIs, success/error toasts, optional keyboard shortcuts, and visual feedback (spin animation, fade-in effect).

dashboard.BREAKDOWN.overallReasoning: All 7 acceptance criteria for the Dashboard Module Breakdown are satisfied with high confidence. The ai/tasks/dashboard/ directory contains 6 fine-grained implementation tasks plus the BREAKDOWN.md file. Each task has specific, testable acceptance criteria with clear requirements. Dependencies on core, asset, and maintenance modules are properly defined in the YAML frontmatter. The statistics service task includes aggregation queries and performance requirements. Role-based layout variants are specified for 3 user roles. KPI cards and ECharts integration are detailed. Manual refresh functionality is comprehensively specified.
codeQualityNotes: Task structure follows the project's established patterns
Dependencies are well-organized in a logical order (backend → frontend)
Test requirements are specified with appropriate patterns for each task type
Priority ordering (1-6) reflects correct implementation sequence
